boat.name: Sylvia Ruth
boat.full_description:
'Sylvia Ruth' is a traditional 12’ clinker sailing dinghy, built at Woodbridge by award winning boatbuilder Tim Wallace Smith in 2015. She is based on the Brightlingsea 'Sea Ranger'. She was named, by her builder, after his mother.

Traditionally crafted in oak, larch and iroko with spruce spars, she is the latest boat based on the design by Fred Mitchell. A number of the originals are still being sailed and raced at the Gunfleet Sailing Club, Clacton.

‘Svlvia Ruth’ is gunter rigged, with galvanised pivoted centreplate and folding rudder. She is copper fastened with a blend of bronze and galvanised fittings. Her sail wardrobe is by the Levington trained Sail Medic Tom Brunton.
boat.construction_details: Clinker construction, oak, larch and iroko, copper fastened. Galvanised centreboard.
boat.short_description: 'Sylvia Ruth' is a traditionally built gunter rigged clinker dinghy.
